EmailTemplate.name: RE: MBO Information (1322858103.0)
EmailTemplate.subject: RE: MBO Information (1322858103.0)
EmailTemplate.textOnly:
1024x768 Clean false false false EN-US X-NONE X-NONE MicrosoftInternetExplorer4 Hi Vernice,
You are very welcome!
When working through us, you can only be a part of our benefits plan if you are actively billing. If for some reason a project ends and you know there wont be work for more than a month we would have to cancel your benefits and at that time you would be eligible to go on Cobra (and the premium would be only about 2% more than the regular premium). We cannot allow people to send us payment for the benefits because it is an employer sponsored plan and if someone isnt working they cannot be a part of the medical benefits. Usually if there is a long amount of time between projects we would place your account in alumni status effectively closing the account for accounting purposes but you can easily re-enroll if you get another project and at the time you are re-activated you would be eligible to join the benefits plan again.
Please let me know if you have any additional questions.
Thank you, Nicolette
___________________________________ Nicolette Taylor Consultant Services Advisor MBO Partners
t: 703.793.6281 f: 703.793.6456 e: ntaylor@mbopartners.com w: www.mbopartners.com
Notice: This email and any files transmitted with it are confidential. They are intended solely for the use of the individual addressed. If you have received this email in error please notify postmaster@mbopartners.com and permanently delete the e-mail and files.
From: Vernice Davis [mailto:vernicedavis@att.net] Sent: Thursday, December 01, 2011 9:17 PM To: Nicolette Taylor Subject: Re: MBO Information
Hi Nicolette,
Thanks for the information. I scanned through it and plan to carefully review it over the weekend.
Can you please clarify how benefits coverage would be handled when I am not working? To maintain coverage, would I continue to pay the same monthly benefits costs as when I am working on a client project?
Vernice Davis
--- On Thu, 12/1/11, Nicolette Taylor <ntaylor@mbopartners.com> wrote:
From: Nicolette Taylor <ntaylor@mbopartners.com> Subject: MBO Information To: "Vernice Davis" <vernicedavis@att.net> Date: Thursday, December 1, 2011, 4:01 PM Hi Vernice,
It was a pleasure speaking with you today! Thank you for your interest in MBO Partners. Ive included a few items as promised regarding the MBO Program:
Link to our true group benefits: http://www.mbopartners.com/mbo-exec-group-benefitsLink to 2012 benefits: http://www.mbopartners.com/mbo-exec-group-benefits-medical-plan-2012 Link to a summary of the value of using MBO Partners: http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Partners_Introduction.pdf Link to our Expense Policy: http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Partners_Expense_Policy.pdf Link to a video about How We Help Independent Consultants:http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=zKDzwSTmGv4&hd=1
Using MBO Partners versus working on a 1099 basis:http://info.mbopartners.com/rs/mbo/images/MBO_Partners_vs_1099_Comparison.pdf
Also, below are a few articles just for you to read at your leisure:
http://www.channelinsider.com/c/a/Spotlight/Top-Mistakes-New-IT-Consultants-Make-And-How-to-Avoid-Making-Them-Yourself-180466/
http://www.marketwire.com/press-release/Landmark-National-Study-Reveals-Millions-Join-New-Age-Career-Independence-Surprising-1557357.htm
If you have any additional questions for me feel free to schedule a convenient time using my online schedule: https://my.timedriver.com/9TGRK
Have a great day and I look forward to speaking with you again soon!
Thank you, Nicolette
___________________________________ Nicolette Taylor Consultant Services Advisor MBO Partners
